ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwó Mǒonsê ngie:
en: The Lord also spoke to Moses:

ngiemboon: Líe tá ńgyá: n toŋó Mbetsaleyɛɛ na lezíŋ sé, n gɔɔn míŋ Ulîi gẅie aa míŋ Ûu, á nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ ndá Yúndà.
en: “Look, I have appointed by name Bezalel   son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.

ngiemboon: N neŋé Zẅìge Ssé na yé, mbɔɔ zsénò, mbɔɔ legye, lélɔg faʼ mefàʼ mentí mentí.
en: I have filled him with God’s Spirit, with wisdom, understanding, and ability in every craft

ngiemboon: À zsé lélɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ, mbɔɔ tʉ̌ nkáb pɔ́ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀, ńnyɛte shúm mbòŋo.
en: to design artistic works in gold, silver, and bronze,

ngiemboon: À zsé lépagte metǒon, ńná shÿó mǒ páʼ mé ge lɔg kẅiŋe mmó, à zsé lékwóon tÿǒ, á gẅiin shÿó. À zɔɔn ńzsé légÿo mmó ntsèm.
en: to cut gemstones for mounting, and to carve wood for work in every craft.

ngiemboon: N da náa nyìŋ gẅie à ge kẅéte yé, á gwɔ́ Oliyab míŋ Ayisamag, á nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ ndá Ndaŋ. N da néŋe zsénò tsɛ̀ɛ mentʉ́m pʉ̀a metsèm pie é zsé nò na levfò, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie n ka cʉ́me mbwó gù:
en: I have also selected Oholiab   son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, to be with him. I have put wisdom in the heart of every skilled artisan  # 31:6 Lit everyone wise of heart in order to make all that I have commanded you:

ngiemboon: á mmó páʼ ntàb mbumté, mbɔɔ kʉbé kʉ̀a, pɔ́ nzìŋe gie ée ndumó, tà mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie áa ye ntàb;
en: the tent of meeting, the ark of the testimony, the mercy seat that is on top of it, and all the other furnishings of the tent    #— #

ngiemboon: ńgÿo tápèle mbɔɔ shúm sé ntsèm, ńgÿo letÿɔgɔ́ melâm, é sie é lʉ́ate, pâ shúm sé ntsèm, ńgÿo jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ we lìi pâ shúm sé ntsèm,
en: the table with its utensils, the pure gold lampstand with all its utensils, the altar of incense,

ngiemboon: mbɔɔ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ we nɔ̀ɔn gẅie mé tuɔ tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm pâ sé shúm, ńgÿo twókáŋ mbɔɔ kwò yɛ̌,
en: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, the basin with its stand #— #

ngiemboon: ńgÿo menzsǒ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ melínɔ̀ɔn, mbɔɔ menzsǒ ndʉalʉ̌a me Áloŋ gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ, ńgÿo menzsǒ fàʼ penkʉ́ pé;
en: the specially woven   garments, both the holy garments for the priest Aaron and the garments for his sons to serve as priests,

ngiemboon: ńgÿo mevɛ́ ndʉalʉ̌a pɔ́ lìi gie agyě kwɔ́ʼ, á jʉʼʉ ndʉalʉ̌a. Pɔ́ ge láʼ gÿo kwàʼ ndʉŋndʉŋ mmó gie n da gɔɔn mbwó gù.
en: the anointing oil, and the fragrant incense for the sanctuary. They must make them according to all that I have commanded you.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwó Mǒonsê ngie:

Gɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngie: pi zsé ngie, pi ge láʼa tÿɔ́gɔ kwò na melyɛʼɛ́ nzse mɔ́ɔn: á ge gÿo gwɔ́ tàʼa liŋé á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, á na mejwoŋó mí ntsèm, tá à cʉa púʼu mé zsé ngie mèŋ zɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à gÿo pi cʉ́ʼ ndʉalʉ̌a.
en: “Tell the Israelites: You must observe my Sabbaths, for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations, so that you will know that I am the Lord who consecrates you.

ngiemboon: Pi ge láʼa tÿɔ́gɔ kwò na lyɛʼɛ́ nzse; mélàʼmie áa mbwó pi ńgwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a. Nyìŋ gẅie à te láʼ tÿɔ́gɔ kwò mǒ wɔ́, é piŋ faʼa fàʼ na yɛ̌ lyɛ̌ʼ, mé ge fó pʉ̀a pɔ́b jwoŋo yé, é gÿo à kwé.
en: Observe the Sabbath, for it is holy to you. Whoever profanes it must be put to death. If anyone does work on it, that person must be cut off from his people.

ngiemboon: Pi ge láʼ faʼ mefàʼ na melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ ntɔgɔ́; táʼ alyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔnmbʉ́a, à gwɔ́ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse, á lyɛʼɛ́ nzse lézẅɛte, ńgwɔ́ ye ndʉalʉ̌a mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdáʼ faʼa fàʼ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse mbà mé ge zẅé ngàŋ.
en: Work may be done for six days, but on the seventh day there must be a Sabbath of complete rest,   holy to the Lord. Anyone who does work on the Sabbath day must be put to death.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ge láʼa tÿɔ́gɔ kwò na lyɛʼɛ́ nzse; pɔ́ ge láʼa zse wɛ̌ nzse, á na mejwoŋó mɔ́b ntsèm, páʼ kʉ̀a ye ngwòŋ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm.
en: The Israelites must observe the Sabbath, celebrating it throughout their generations as a permanent covenant.

ngiemboon: Áa liŋé gie á ge láʼ gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ peg lâ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm. Á nue mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n da lɔg lyɛ̌ʼ ntɔgɔ́ ńnyɛte lefaŋ pɔ́ tsetsáʼ, á piŋ ńgwɔ́ na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔnmbʉ́a, n zẅɛte.
en: It is a sign forever between me and the Israelites, for in six days the Lord made the heavens and the earth, but on the seventh day he rested and was refreshed.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn nò mbwó Mǒonsê, á ndùm lekwɛ́ Sinayi tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, ńdeen ńná melàŋa tóon mémbʉ́a á mbwó yé, é gwɔ́ me kʉ̀a, é melàŋa tóon mie kwaʼ yé Ssé la lɔgɔ tepwó ńŋweʼe mmó mǒ.
en: When he finished speaking with Moses on Mount Sinai, he gave him the two tablets of the testimony, stone tablets inscribed by the finger of God.
